abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed project involves the
            carrying out of: (a) about 30 local subprojects (1,600
            schools, 6,100 teachers and 112,000 students in total); and
            (b) six national subprojects. Each local subproject is an
            investment plan aimed at the educational needs of some 20-70
            rural primary schools and 1,800-7,200 pupils. It includes
            training of teachers, supply of educational materials and
            furniture, supervision, equipment, and civil works for
            repair and upgrading of existing buildings. The national
            subprojects are for: (a) production of the needed textbooks
            and other educational materials; (b) production of furniture
            and equipment; (c) training of administrators and planners;
            (d) development of a computerized management information
            system; (e) expansion of applied research on education; and
            (f) impact evaluation of the Subsector Program.
